slashCommands.name: stride-claim
slashCommands.prompt: Help me claim the next available task from Stride. First call GET /api/tasks/next, then POST /api/tasks/claim with the task_id. Execute the before_doing hook before starting work.

slashCommands.name: stride-complete
slashCommands.prompt: Help me complete the current task. Remember to: 1) Execute after_doing hook FIRST, 2) Only if hook succeeds, call PATCH /api/tasks/:id/complete, 3) Execute before_review hook (non-blocking).

slashCommands.name: stride-create
slashCommands.prompt: Help me create a new Stride task. Remember: Don't specify identifier (auto-generated), verification_steps must be array of objects, testing_strategy fields must be arrays, type must be 'work'/'defect'/'goal'.

systemMessage:
You are working with the Stride task management system.

CRITICAL RULES:

1. Never specify identifiers when creating tasks (auto-generated as G1, W47, D12)
2. verification_steps must be array of objects with step_type, step_text, expected_result, position
3. testing_strategy fields (unit_tests, integration_tests, manual_tests) must be arrays
4. type must be exactly 'work', 'defect', or 'goal' as strings
5. Execute after_doing hook BEFORE calling complete endpoint

HOOK EXECUTION:
Stride has four client-side hooks:
- before_doing (60s, blocking) - Before starting work
- after_doing (120s, blocking) - After work, BEFORE calling complete endpoint
- before_review (60s, non-blocking) - When entering review
- after_review (60s, non-blocking) - After approval

Blocking hooks must succeed for workflow to continue.

ESSENTIAL TASK FIELDS:
Required: type, title
Critical: key_files, dependencies, verification_steps, testing_strategy
Recommended: description, complexity, priority, needs_review, pitfalls, patterns_to_follow, acceptance_criteria

COMPLETION ORDER:
1. Finish work
2. Execute after_doing hook (tests, lint, build)
3. Only if hook succeeds, call PATCH /api/tasks/:id/complete
4. Execute before_review hook (non-blocking)

BATCH CREATION:
Root key must be 'goals' (not 'tasks'). Dependencies within goals use array indices [0, 1]. Cross-goal dependencies don't work in batch.

DOCUMENTATION:
- Onboarding: https://www.stridelikeaboss.com/api/agent/onboarding
- Task Writing: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cheezy/kanban/refs/heads/main/docs/TASK-WRITING-GUIDE.md
- API Reference: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cheezy/kanban/refs/heads/main/docs/api/README.md

NOTE: For comprehensive workflow enforcement, Claude Code users should install the four Stride Skills from the onboarding endpoint.
